ExecutableTestSuite.label: Conformance class: Information accessibility, Utility and Government Services
ExecutableTestSuite.description:
This test suite examines a data set against the themespecific requirements related to the accessibility of resources referenced by the data.

This is a draft version. It has limitations and is expected to contain errors. Please report any issues or problems in GitHub.

Known limitations are documented in the description of the applicable test case or test assertion. There is a general limitation in all assertions that extensions in additional application schemas are only supported, if the unqualified name of the feature type in the extension is the same as the name of the feature type in the INSPIRE application schema.

Source: Conformance Class 'Information accessibility, Utility and Government Services'

Pre-requisite conformance classes:
  • Conformance Class 'Information accessibility'
ExecutableTestSuite.author: Consortium Bilbomatica, Guadaltel y Geograma

ParameterList.name: ETF Standard Parameters for XML test objects

TestCase.label: Code lists
TestCase.description: Verify that code lists extensions can be accessed.

TestAssertion.label: us-ia.a.1: SpecificAppurtenanceTypeValue
TestAssertion.description:
Verify that any code list extensions are publicly accessible via HTTP, i.e. inspect extensible code list valued property elements. If a reference (@xlink:href) has a value that does not start with http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/, verify that a HTTP GET request to the URI retrieves a document.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (3): Code Lists and Enumerations. Where, for an attribute whose type is a code list as referred to in points (b), (c) or (d) of paragraph 1, a data provider provides a value that is not specified in this Regulation, that value and its definition shall be made available in a register.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Code lists', INSPIRE Data Specification on Utility and Government Services, A.5.1

TestAssertion.label: us-ia.a.2: OilGasChemicalsProductTypeValue
TestAssertion.description:
Verify that any code list extensions are publicly accessible via HTTP, i.e. inspect extensible code list valued property elements. Where, for an attribute whose type is a code list as referred to in points (b), (c) or (d) of paragraph 1, a data provider provides a value that is not specified in this Regulation, that value and its definition shall be made available in a register.

TestCase.label: Feature references
TestCase.description: Verify that referenced features can be retrieved.

TestAssertion.label: us-ia.b.1: UtilityNetwork.networks
TestAssertion.description:
Verify that any feature reference in an association role is publicly accessible via HTTP, i.e. inspect all relevant properties. If a reference (@xlink:href) has a value that starts with "#", verify that an element with a gml:id attribute with the referenced identifier exists in the same document. If the reference starts with "http", verify that a HTTP GET request to the URI retrieves an XML document.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (2): Types for the Exchange and Classification of Spatial Objects. Spatial object types and data types shall comply with the definitions and constraints and include the attributes and association roles set out in the Annexes.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Feature references', INSPIRE Data Specification on Utility and Government Services, A.1.4
TestAssertion.expression:
let $features_selected := $features[self::us-net-common:UtilityNetwork] let $gml_ids := $features//@gml:id let $property_string := 'UtilityNetwork.networks' let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected let $envDom := $feature/us-net-common:networks let $urls := for $x in $envDom/@xlink:href return if (starts-with($x, '#')) then () else $x let $map := local:check-resource-uris($urls, 30, true()) let $invalid_urls := for $href in $urls let $url := string($href) let $validuri := map:get($map, $url) return if ($validuri = 'notHTTP' or starts-with($validuri, 'EXCEPTION') or $validuri = 'idNotFound' or matches($validuri,'^\d{3}$')) then $url else () let $invalid_element_reference := for $x in $envDom/@xlink:href return if (starts-with($x, '#')) then if (not(substring($x, 2) = $gml_ids)) then $x else () else ()
return if(count($invalid_urls) > 0) then local:addMessage('TR.brokenLinkUtilGovServ', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string-join($invalid_urls, ',')}) else if (count($invalid_element_reference) > 0) then local:addMessage('TR.missingReferencedElementUtilGovServ', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string-join($invalid_element_reference, ',')}) else () return (if ($messages) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)

TestAssertion.label: us-ia.b.2: Cabinet.nodes
TestAssertion.description:
Verify that any feature reference in an association role is publicly accessible via HTTP, i.e. inspect all relevant properties. If a reference (@xlink:href) has a value that starts with "#", verify that an element with a gml:id attribute with the referenced identifier exists in the same document. If the reference starts with "http", verify that a HTTP GET request to the URI retrieves an XML document.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (2): Types for the Exchange and Classification of Spatial Objects. Spatial object types and data types shall comply with the definitions and constraints and include the attributes and association roles set out in the Annexes.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Feature references', INSPIRE Data Specification on Utility and Government Services, A.1.4
TestAssertion.expression:
let $features_selected := $features[self::us-net-common:Cabinet] let $gml_ids := $features//@gml:id let $property_string := 'Cabinet.nodes' let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected let $envDom := $feature/us-net-common:nodes let $urls := for $x in $envDom/@xlink:href return if (starts-with($x, '#')) then () else $x let $map := local:check-resource-uris($urls, 30, true()) let $invalid_urls := for $href in $urls let $url := string($href) let $validuri := map:get($map, $url) return if ($validuri = 'notHTTP' or starts-with($validuri, 'EXCEPTION') or $validuri = 'idNotFound' or matches($validuri,'^\d{3}$')) then $url else () let $invalid_element_reference := for $x in $envDom/@xlink:href return if (starts-with($x, '#')) then if (not(substring($x, 2) = $gml_ids)) then $x else () else ()
return if(count($invalid_urls) > 0) then local:addMessage('TR.brokenLinkUtilGovServ', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string-join($invalid_urls, ',')}) else if (count($invalid_element_reference) > 0) then local:addMessage('TR.missingReferencedElementUtilGovServ', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string-join($invalid_element_reference, ',')}) else () return (if ($messages) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)

TestAssertion.label: us-ia.b.8: Duct.pipes

Verify that any feature reference in an association role is publicly accessible via HTTP, i.e. inspect all relevant properties. If a reference (@xlink:href) has a value that starts with "#", verify that an element with a gml:id attribute with the referenced identifier exists in the same document. If the reference starts with "http", verify that a HTTP GET request to the URI retrieves an XML document.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (2): Types for the Exchange and Classification of Spatial Objects. Spatial object types and data types shall comply with the definitions and constraints and include the attributes and association roles set out in the Annexes.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Feature references', INSPIRE Data Specification on Utility and Government Services, A.1.4
TestAssertion.expression:
let $features_selected := $features[self::us-net-common:Duct] let $gml_ids := $features//@gml:id let $property_string := 'Duct.pipes' let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected let $envDom := $feature/us-net-common:pipes let $urls := for $x in $envDom/@xlink:href return if (starts-with($x, '#')) then () else $x let $map := local:check-resource-uris($urls, 30, true()) let $invalid_urls := for $href in $urls let $url := string($href) let $validuri := map:get($map, $url) return if ($validuri = 'notHTTP' or starts-with($validuri, 'EXCEPTION') or $validuri = 'idNotFound' or matches($validuri,'^\d{3}$')) then $url else () let $invalid_element_reference := for $x in $envDom/@xlink:href return if (starts-with($x, '#')) then if (not(substring($x, 2) = $gml_ids)) then $x else () else ()
return if (not(count($envDom) = count($envDom/@xlink:href))) then local:addMessage('TR.missingAttributeUtilGovServ', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'attribute': 'xlink:href'}) else if (count($invalid_urls) > 0) then local:addMessage('TR.brokenLinkUtilGovServ', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string-join($invalid_urls, ',')}) else if (count($invalid_element_reference) > 0) then local:addMessage('TR.missingReferencedElementUtilGovServ', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string-join($invalid_element_reference, ',')}) else () return (if ($messages) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)

TestAssertion.expression:
let $features_selected := $features[self::us-net-common:Pipe] let $gml_ids := $features//@gml:id let $property_string := 'Pipe.pipes' let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected let $envDom := $feature/us-net-common:pipes let $urls := for $x in $envDom/@xlink:href return if (starts-with($x, '#')) then () else $x let $map := local:check-resource-uris($urls, 30, true()) let $invalid_urls := for $href in $urls let $url := string($href) let $validuri := map:get($map, $url) return if ($validuri = 'notHTTP' or starts-with($validuri, 'EXCEPTION') or $validuri = 'idNotFound' or matches($validuri,'^\d{3}$')) then $url else () let $invalid_element_reference := for $x in $envDom/@xlink:href return if (starts-with($x, '#')) then if (not(substring($x, 2) = $gml_ids)) then $x else () else ()
return if(count($invalid_urls) > 0) then local:addMessage('TR.brokenLinkUtilGovServ', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string-join($invalid_urls, ',')}) else if (count($invalid_element_reference) > 0) then local:addMessage('TR.missingReferencedElementUtilGovServ', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string-join($invalid_element_reference, ',')}) else () return (if ($messages) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)

TestAssertion.label: us-ia.b.11: EnvironmentalManagementFacility.parentFacility
TestAssertion.description:
Verify that any feature reference in an association role is publicly accessible via HTTP, i.e. inspect all relevant properties. If a reference (@xlink:href) has a value that starts with "#", verify that an element with a gml:id attribute with the referenced identifier exists in the same document. If the reference starts with "http", verify that a HTTP GET request to the URI retrieves an XML document.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 4 (2): Types for the Exchange and Classification of Spatial Objects. Spatial object types and data types shall comply with the definitions and constraints and include the attributes and association roles set out in the Annexes.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Feature references', INSPIRE Data Specification on Utility and Government Services, A.1.4
TestAssertion.expression:
let $features_selected := $features[self::us-emf:EnvironmentalManagementFacility] let $gml_ids := $features//@gml:id let $property_string := 'EnvironmentalManagementFacility.parentFacility' let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected let $envDom := $feature/us-emf:parentFacility let $urls := for $x in $envDom/@xlink:href return if (starts-with($x, '#')) then () else $x let $map := local:check-resource-uris($urls, 30, true()) let $invalid_urls := for $href in $urls let $url := string($href) let $validuri := map:get($map, $url) return if ($validuri = 'notHTTP' or starts-with($validuri, 'EXCEPTION') or $validuri = 'idNotFound' or matches($validuri,'^\d{3}$')) then $url else () let $invalid_element_reference := for $x in $envDom/@xlink:href return if (starts-with($x, '#')) then if (not(substring($x, 2) = $gml_ids)) then $x else () else ()
return if(count($invalid_urls) > 0) then local:addMessage('TR.brokenLinkUtilGovServ', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string-join($invalid_urls, ',')}) else if (count($invalid_element_reference) > 0) then local:addMessage('TR.missingReferencedElementUtilGovServ', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string-join($invalid_element_reference, ',')}) else () return (if ($messages) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)
